paper_title.ja: Aerials algae from southwestern area of Lake Baikal

paper_title.en: Aerials algae from southwestern area of Lake Baikal

description.en: Seventy-four specimens of maritime lichen, representing 22 species, were collected from seven localities in western Japan. Photobionts were isolated from their thalli and studied taxonomically. Fourteen species of Chlorophyta were isolated. Four species of algae-Trebouxia gigantea, T. higginsiae, T. impressa, and Elliptochloris bilobata-are reported for the first time from Japan. This is the first report on photobionts from maritime lichens in Japan. Salt tolerance of these species is discussed.

There is one previous report that Sphaerophorus has exclusively Trebouxia as photobiont. Our results are in contradiction to that report. We isolated the photobionts from four species of Sphaerophorus (calicialean lichen) collected in Japan. These were identified as a unicellular green alga, Dictyochloropsis symbiontica Tsch.-Woess. This is the first record at the species level on the photobiont of Sphaerophorus. There is one previous report on lichens of the Caliciales and two families of Lecanorales (Lobariaceae, Lecideaceae) having this species as their photobionts. Our results support those observations.

paper_title.en: Dilabifilum arthopyreniae (Chlorophyta) newly found in Japan

description.en: Dilabifilum arthopyrenine (Vischer et Klement) Tsch.-Woess (Chaetophorales, Chlorophyta) was isolated from a crevice of a granite boulder on the sea-shore in Japan. This is the first record of this species in Japan. Under culture conditions the alga reproduced by zoospores, aplanospores and thallus fragmentation. Morphology was identical when grown in fresh and sea-water media. This seems to be a consequence of adaptation to a harsh habitat in the littoral fringe.

paper_title.en: The identity of photobionts from the lichen Pyrenula Japonica 共著
Studies on two species of Eremosphaera De Bary (Chlorophyceae) in Japan
An Illistrated Atlas of the Life History of Algae
PHOTOBIONTS ISOLATED FROM SOME JAPANESE SPECIES OF CLADONIA (LICHENS)

description.en: Three species of Trebouxia were isolated as photobionts from 10 Japanese species of Cladonia. They were Trebouxia erici, T. excentrica and T. glomerata. In this study, photobionts were newly isolated form eight species of Cladonia. The results of this and previous studies indicate that a few species of Cladonia have two photobionts, which are occurring in individual lichen thalli. However, a single algal partner is restricted to many species of Cladonia. Trebouxia erici, T. excentrica, T. glomerata and T. pyriformis are the most frequent photobionts of the Cladonia, species.
